1.verse: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:
My son, if thou wilt receive my words,
My son, forget not my law;
Hear, my sons, the instruction of a father,
My son, attend unto my wisdom;
My son, if thou art become surety for thy neighbor,
My son, keep my words,
Doth not wisdom cry,
Wisdom hath builded her house;
The proverbs of Solomon.
A false balance is an abomination to Jehovah;
Whoso loveth correction loveth knowledge;
A wise son heareth his father’s instruction;
Every wise woman buildeth her house;
A soft answer turneth away wrath;
The plans of the heart belong to man;
Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith,
He that separateth himself seeketh his own desire,
Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity
Wine is a mocker, strong drink a brawler;
The king’s heart is in the hand of Jehovah as the watercourses:
A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches,
When thou sittest to eat with a ruler,
Be not thou envious against evil men;
These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest,
Boast not thyself of tomorrow;
The wicked flee when no man pursueth;
He that being often reproved hardeneth his neck
The words of Agur the son of Jakeh; the oracle.
The words of king Lemuel; the oracle which his mother taught him.
